00014     Net::Net(unsigned _threads)
00015     {
00016         lastNeuronId = 0;
00017         setThreadCount(_threads);
00018         biasId = addNeuron(ActivationFunction::Linear::Instance());
00019         addConnection(biasId, biasId, 1);

00032     void
00033     Net::setThreadCount(unsigned _threads)
00034     {
00035         cache.touch();
00036 
00037         if(_threads == 0)
00038         {
00039             threadCount = boost::thread::hardware_concurrency();
00040             return;
00041         }
00042 
00043         if(_threads < 1 || _threads > 64)
00044             throw Exception::RangeMismatch()<<"Net::run(): currently only up to 64 concurrent threads supported\n";
00045 
00046         threadCount = _threads;
00047     } //setThreadCount

00064     void
00065     Net::delNeuron(unsigned _neuronId)
00066     {
00067         Neuron* n = findNeuron(_neuronId);
00068 
00069         delNeuron(n);
00070 
00071         //Remove neuron from registers
00072         setNeuronRole(n, WorkNeuron);
00073         neurons.erase(_neuronId);
00074     } //delNeuron

00112     void
00113     Net::setInput(const valarray<Float>& _input)
00114     {
00115         if(_input.size() < inputNeurons.size())
00116             throw Exception::SizeMismatch()<<"setInput(): Supplied input size is smaller "
00117                                                           "then number of input neurons\n";
00118 
00119         if(_input.size() > inputNeurons.size())
00120             Exception::Warning()<<"setInput(): Input size is bigger then input neurons count. "
00121                                                "Check getInputMap() output\n";
00122 
00123         unsigned i = 0;
00124         BOOST_FOREACH( Neuron* n, inputNeurons)
00125             n->receptiveField += _input[i++];
00126     } //setInput

00148     void
00149     Net::getOutput(valarray<Float>& _output) const
00150     {
00151         map<unsigned, Float> output = getOutput();
00152         _output.resize(output.size());
00153 
00154         unsigned i = 0;
00155         for(map<unsigned, Float>::const_iterator iter = output.begin(); iter != output.end(); ++iter)

00159     void
00160     Net::run(Runner* _runner)
00161     {
00162         if( !cache.isOk() )
00163             regenerateCache();
00164 
00165         boost::thread_group threadPool;
00166         boost::barrier barrier(threadCount);
00167 
00168         //We must give parameters by pointer, because boost will copy all arguments to thread
00169         for(unsigned thread = 0; thread < threadCount; ++thread)
00170             threadPool.add_thread( new boost::thread(Net::threadBase, _runner, &cache, thread, &barrier) );
00171         
00172         //wait for threads to finish
00173         threadPool.join_all();
00174     } //run

00194     Neuron*
00195     Net::findNeuron(unsigned _neuronId)
00196     {
00197         map<unsigned, Neuron*>::iterator iter = neurons.find(_neuronId);
00198         if(neurons.end() == iter)
00199             throw Exception::ObjectNotFound()<<"findNeuron(): Neuron "<<_neuronId<<" not found\n";
00200 
00201         return iter->second;
00202     } //findNeuron

00210     unsigned
00211     Net::addNeuron(Neuron* _neuron)
00212     {
00213         cache.touch();
00214 
00215         pair< map<unsigned, Neuron*>::iterator, bool > result = 
00216             neurons.insert( pair<unsigned, Neuron*>(lastNeuronId, _neuron) );
00217         
00218         if( !result.second )
00219             throw Exception::ElementExists()<<"Net::addNeuron(): insertion of neuron "<<lastNeuronId<<" failed\n";
00220 
00221         return lastNeuronId++;
00222     } //addNeuron

00224     void
00225     Net::delNeuron(Neuron* _neuron)
00226     {
00227         cache.touch();
00228 
00229         //Delete all connections to/from current neuron
00230         for(list<Link>::iterator link_iter = _neuron->links.begin(); link_iter != _neuron->links.end(); )
00231         {
00232             //We will delete link, so we can't use link_iter to get access to Link object
00233             //Copy Link attributes to local variables
00234             Neuron* to = link_iter->getTo();
00235             Link::Direction dir = link_iter->getDirection();
00236             
00237             //Go to next Link (see for loop - it is without ++ statement)
00238             link_iter++;
00239 
00240             if(dir == Link::in)
00241                 delConnection(to, _neuron);
00242             else
00243                 delConnection(_neuron, to);
00244         }
00245 
00246         delete _neuron;
00247     } //delNeuron
00248 
00249     void
00250     Net::setNeuronRole(Neuron* _neuron, NeuronRole _newRole)
00251     {
00252         cache.touch();
00253 
00254         list<Neuron*>::iterator inputIter = find(inputNeurons.begin(), inputNeurons.end(), _neuron);
00255 
00256         switch(_newRole)
00257         {
00258             case InputNeuron:
00259                 if(inputIter == inputNeurons.end())
00260                     inputNeurons.push_back(_neuron);
00261                 break;
00262             case WorkNeuron:
00263                 if(inputIter != inputNeurons.end())
00264                     inputNeurons.erase(inputIter);
00265                 break;
00266         }
00267     } //setNeuronRole
00268 
00269     Net::NeuronRole
00270     Net::getNeuronRole(const Neuron* _neuron) const
00271     {
00272         /*
00273          * 0 - work neuron
00274          * 1 - work+input
00275          */
00276         unsigned role = 0;
00277 
00278         if(find(inputNeurons.begin(), inputNeurons.end(), _neuron) != inputNeurons.end())
00279             role+=1;
00280 
00281         return (NeuronRole)role;
00282     } //getNeuronRole

00284     void
00285     Net::addConnection(Neuron* _from, Neuron* _to, Weight* _weight)
00286     {
00287         cache.touch();
00288 
00289         _from->links.push_back( Link(_to, Link::out, _weight) );
00290         _to->links.push_back( Link(_from, Link::in, _weight) );
00291 
00292         _weight->usageCount += 2;
00293     } //addConnection
00294 
00295     void
00296     Net::delConnection(Neuron* _from, Neuron* _to)
00297     {
00298         cache.touch();
00299 
00300         /* Short unsignedroduction:
00301          * Neuron_from               Neuron_to
00302          *  Link                      Link
00303          *    to =>Neuron2              to =>Neuron1
00304          *    w  =>weight1              w  =>weight1
00305          *    dir=>out                  dir=>in
00306          */
00307 
00308         //Find correspondent Links in neurons
00309         list<Link>::iterator from_link = _from->findLink(_to, Link::out);
00310         list<Link>::iterator to_link = _to->findLink(_from, Link::in);
00311 
00312         //weight1 (see picture) must be common for both Link objects
00313         if(from_link->getWeight() != to_link->getWeight())
00314             throw Exception::Unbelievable()<<"Net::delConnection(): symmetric links don't share weight\n";
00315 
00316         Weight* w = from_link->getWeight();
00317 
00318         //Actually delete Link objects from Neuron_to and Neuron_from
00319         _from->links.erase(from_link);
00320         _to->links.erase(to_link);
00321 
00322         //Delete weight object if it no more used
00323         if( (w->usageCount -= 2) == 0)
00324             delete w;
00325     } //delConnection

00327     void
00328     Net::formatFront(vector<Neuron*>& _raw) const
00329     {
00330         cache.data.push_back( NetCache::FrontType() );
00331         NetCache::FrontType& tasks = cache.data[cache.data.size() - 1];
00332 
00333         for(unsigned i = 0; i < threadCount; i++)
00334             tasks.push_back( vector<Neuron*>() );
00335 
00336         //sort(_raw.begin(), _raw.end(), NeuronIterCompare());
00337         sort(_raw.begin(), _raw.end()); //FIXME Caution!
00338         //vector<Neuron*>::iterator it = unique(_raw.begin(), _raw.end(), NeuronIterCompare::equal);
00339         vector<Neuron*>::iterator it = unique(_raw.begin(), _raw.end());
00340         _raw.resize( it - _raw.begin() );
00341 
00342         for(unsigned i = 0; i < _raw.size(); ++i)
00343             tasks[_raw[i]->getOwnerThread() % threadCount].push_back(_raw[i]);
00344     } //formatFront
00345 
00346     void
00347     Net::regenerateCache() const
00348     {
00349         cache.flush(); 
00350 
00351         //Here we will place neuron's IDs that will become front, with duplicates
00352         vector<Neuron*> rawFront;
00353 
00354         /*
00355          * Function operates with "hops" attribute of every Neuron
00356          * to build adequate cache.
00357          * Unfortunetly, map<unsigned, Neuron>::iterator doesn't have operator< , so
00358          * we shold write own comparison class for hops<>. I placed it to Utils.h
00359          */
00360         //map<Neuron*, unsigned, NeuronIterCompare> hops;
00361         map<Neuron*, unsigned> hops;
00362         
00363         //Put inputNeurons to front
00364         BOOST_FOREACH( Neuron* n, inputNeurons )
00365         {
00366             rawFront.push_back(n);
00367             hops[n] = 1;
00368         }
00369         formatFront(rawFront);
00370         
00371         //Bias neuron is kind of input neuron
00372         Neuron* biasNeuron = const_cast<Net*>(this)->findNeuron(biasId);
00373         cache.data[0][0].push_back(biasNeuron);
00374 
00375         /*
00376          * Cache looks like this:
00377          *
00378          * vector<FrontType> cache.data
00379          *     |
00380          *     |-(0) vector<ThreadTaskType>      <-- * front pounsigneder pounsigneds to this vector
00381          *     |-(1) vector<ThreadTaskType>
00382          *     |-(...)
00383          *     |-(number_of_layers) vector<ThreadTaskType>
00384          *                          |
00385          *                          |-(0) vector<Neuron*> Target neurons for thread1
00386          *                          |-(1) vector<Neuron*> Target neurons for thread2
00387          *
00388          *  At this pounsigned cache.data(0) is the only record and it contains input neurons
00389          */
00390 
00391         do {
00392             /*
00393              * We have better prepare next front
00394              * At first iteration, if you remember, vector<unsigned> _raw contains unique inputNeurons indexes
00395              */
00396             unsigned nCount = rawFront.size();
00397             for(unsigned i = 0; i < nCount; ++i)
00398             {
00399                 //pop_front emulation
00400                 Neuron* currentNeuron = rawFront[0];
00401                 rawFront.erase( rawFront.begin() );
00402 
00403                 //ok, we've got cur_neuron. We will iterate through his Out links
00404                 //and push_back their opposite sides to rawFront
00405                 BOOST_FOREACH( Link& link, currentNeuron->links )
00406                 {
00407                     //Only feedforward links
00408                     if(link.getDirection() == Link::in)
00409                         continue;
00410 
00411                     /*
00412                      * Short comment. Consider following topology (hops are in brackets):
00413                      *   +(0)    <-- output          +(0)             +(3)    <-- front(3)
00414                      *  / \                         / \              / \
00415                      * +(0)+(0)         ======>    +(0)+(0)  ====>  +(2)+(2)  <-- front(2)
00416                      *  \ /           iteration1    \ /        N     \ /
00417                      *   +(0)  <-- input             +(1)             +(1)    <-- front on iteration1
00418                      *
00419                      *   For current neuron (C) and other neuron (T), hops might be:
00420                      *   T = 0  - T-neuron is fresh. We will set T=C+1
00421                      *   T = N, N < C - it is recurrent link. Dont touch T and dont place it unsignedo rawFront
00422                      *   T = C  - it is stupid recursive topology. Currently unsupported. Raise exception
00423                      *   T = C, but t=c  - it is recurrent link over 1 neuron. It is supported
00424                      *   T = C + 1 - T already hadled. Silently ignore T. We can add T to rawFront
00425                      *   T > C + 1 - impossible. Somebody changed hops by hand and didn't touch cache or
00426                      *               after last cache generation algorithm didn't set neuron's hops to zero
00427                      */
00428 
00429                     //Assume that when cache becomes coherent, all neuron[hops] vars become zero
00430                     if(hops[link.getTo()] == 0)
00431                         hops[link.getTo()] = hops[currentNeuron] + link.getLatency();
00432 
00433                     if(hops[link.getTo()] == hops[currentNeuron] + 1)
00434                         rawFront.push_back(link.getTo()); 
00435 
00436                     if(hops[link.getTo()] == hops[currentNeuron] && link.getTo() != currentNeuron)
00437                         throw Exception::Unbelievable()<<"Net::run(): cur_neuron.hops == to.hops. "
00438                                                             "There is no support for such topologies yet\n";
00439                 } //BOOST_FOREACH( Link )
00440 
00441             } //rawFront iteration ( Neuron )
00442 
00443             //new rawFront formed
00444             formatFront(rawFront);
00445             
00446         } while( rawFront.size() > 0 );
00447 
00448         //We rebuilded cache
00449         cache.fixed();
00450 
00451     } //regenerateCache
00452 
00453 }; //pann
